Law-Uy

Law-uy is a traditional Filipino vegetable soup that is both healthy and flavorful. It is made with a variety of vegetables and often includes seafood or meat. Here's a recipe for law-uy that you can try at home:

Ingredients

  • 1 small onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, sliced
  • 2 tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 small bitter gourd (ampalaya), sliced
  • 1 medium-sized eggplant, sliced
  • 1 cup malunggay leaves
  • 1 cup kangkong leaves
  • 4 cups water or seafood stock
  • 1/2 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
  • Salt and pepper, to taste

    • Procedures

  • In a large pot, sauté the onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
  • Add the tomatoes and cook until soft and mushy.
  • Add the bitter gourd and eggplant, and cook until slightly tender.
  • Pour in the water or seafood stock and bring to a boil.
  • Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until they turn pink.
  • Add the malunggay and kangkong leaves and cook for another minute.
  • Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  • Serve hot with steamed rice.

    • Try this other recipes!
